page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content:
AS THERE IS LITTLE PRIMARY,SECONDARY OR TERTIARY INDUSTRY WITHIN THE AREA IT IS NECESSARY FOR THE VAST MAJORITY OF PEOPLE TO TRANSPORT THEMSELVES OUT OF THE AREA.THIS IS REFLECTED BY THE RESULTS OF THE QUESTIONAIRE{*}WHICH SHOWED THAT FROM THE 100 PEOPLE QUESTIONED THERE WAS MORE THAN 1 CAR PER HOUSEHOLD.THERE IS ALSO A REGULAR BUS ROUTE THROUGH THE AREA.THE FASTEST MOVING TRANSPORT WITHIN THE AREA IS WHERE THE SWANSEA-CARDIFF BRITISH RAIL LINE RUNS THROUGH IT.ALTHOUGH REMAINS ARE EVIDENT OF THE ROMAN ROAD THROUGH THE AREA THE OLDEST FORM OF TRANSPORT IS PROVIDED BY THE TENNANT CANAL.
{* QUESTIONNAIRE AND RESULTS ARE TO BE {FOUND ON PAGES 7 AND 8 OF THIS SURVEY.
